ext_descriptions.ext_description: A mounting_technology_type lists the type of the mounting technology.
specifies that component is surface mount;
specifies that component is through hole.

ext_description.p: A predefined_lead_form lists the predefined classification of the lead form provided by this part of ISO 10303. The form refers to the form as provided by the supplier of the component.
ext_description.note: A externally provided classification scheme may be used to extend the lead form classification over that provided in this version of this part of ISO 10303.
An integral terminal form is flush with the body of the package surface.
ext_description.example: A straight lead that was altered to support orientation requirements would still be classified as a straight lead since the component manufacturer delived the component with straight leads.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies that the predefined form of the lead is gull wing;
specifies that the predefined form of the lead is j lead;
specifies that the predefined form of the lead is reversed j lead;

ext_description.p: specifies that the predefined form of the lead is integral terminal;

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies that the predefined form of the lead is undefined;
specifies that the predefined form of the lead is ball;
specifies that the predefined form of the lead is straight.
A seating_plane_intersection_type lists the types of the intersection between a feature and a .
specifies that the surface of the feature indicated is congruent with the seating plane;
specifies that the feature penetrates the seating plane;
specifies that the feature does not intersect the seating plane.

ext_description.p:
A Connection_zone_in_part_feature_template_definition is a type of
in which the context is a . A Connection_zone_in_part_feature_template_definition is included in a template definition to provide an explicit geometric model of the limited areas in the domain of a terminal that are allowed for a valid connection. If the template definition contains no limitations on the connection area of the terminals associated with the template this Application Object shall not be provided.
ext_description.note: In some less detailed templates, the entire point domain for features designated as terminals is considered to be available for connection and the Connection_zone_in_part_feature_template_definition is redundant.

In the case where the connection area is necessary, the application shall be carefully reviewed to determine the necessity for design instances of the connection area as in most cases, simply using the connection area as a constraint on the allowed location of a joint is sufficient.

The level of detail included in a template definition may be classified by a user-defined classification system which is supported by this part of ISO 10303 but this part of ISO 10303 does not predefine a classification system for template detail level.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the role of the
for the Connection_zone_in_part_feature_template_definition.

The
shall not be populated.

ext_description.p: A Connection_zone_package_interface_plane_relationship is a mechanism to establish a derived relationship declaration between two connection areas using a common plane as the interface declaration. A Connection_zone_package_interface_plane_relationship may be represented in a geometric context for the purpose of deriving a 2D or 3D representation.
ext_description.example: A common application of this is the case where there is a three dimensional model of a terminal where that terminal is cut by a seating plane and it is necessary to derive a two dimensional area of that terminal for layout purposes. In this case, the context for both connection areas would be the same terminal definition but one connection area would be three dimensional and the other connection area would be two dimensional.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Connection_zone_package_interface_plane_relationship is dependent on the the existence of the
that specifies the Connection_zone_package_interface_plane_relationship as its . There shall be no more than one
for a Connection_zone_package_interface_plane_relationship.
specifies the text that describes the Connection_zone_package_interface_plane_relationship.

specifies the role of the
for the Connection_zone_package_interface_plane_relationship.

specifies the role of the
for the Connection_zone_package_interface_plane_relationship.

ext_description.p: The derived_zone_shape_class will be 'area' or 'edge'.
A Guided_wave_terminal is a type of that is explicitly included for the purpose of providing access to the functionality of a using guided waves.
ext_description.example: A Fiber-optic terminal is considered to be a Guided_wave_terminal in this part of ISO 10303 because the signal is launched from the end surface of the terminal.

ext_description.p: A Package is a type of a . A Package describes a subset of the physical properties of a component relevant to use of that component in an assembly. Some items are mandatory for any instance of a Package, some items are used for assuring proper orientation and some items are used for analysis. A Package includes no more than one package body and one or more package terminals. A Package includes a seating plane when a mounting technology is specified.

example.p: Figures 1 through 2 illustrate types of Packages and parameters related to Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing supported by this part of ISO 10303. ISO 10303-202 would be used in conjunction with this part of ISO 10303 to define the exchange of the presentation information (i.e., the drawings). This part of ISO 10303 supports the direct application to application exchange of the parametric data illustrated in the drawings.

Figures 3 through 4 illustrate parameters and features related to Package orientation for assembly purposes supported by this part of ISO 10303. ISO 10303-202 would be used in conjunction with this part of ISO 10303 to define the exchange of the presentation information (i.e., the drawings).

ext_description.note: The location of the as illustrated in Figure 4 is not constrained by electrical functionality unless there are visually identifiable features that indicate polarity or orientation requirements. The top row in the Figure illustrates three situations where there are no visual features indicating requirements and the selection is arbitrary. The polarized part in the second row in the Figure illustrates a case where there is a visual feature indicating a functional orientation requirement due to the nature of the part.
When used for a "white box model", the is installed in the Package and an electrical connection is defined between each terminal on the installed and one or more terminals on the Package.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Package is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Package as its . There shall be no more than one
for a Package in this role.

an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Package is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Package as its . There shall be zero or more Package_terminal for a Package.

ext_description.p:
specifies the role of the
for the Package. The simulates the interface surface of an external device. There shall exist zero or more Interface_planes in the role of interface_plane.
ext_description.note: The interface_plane is typically used for connectors, but may be used for modules.
ext_description.example: A use of interface_plane is in the case of a fiber-optic transceiver that is mounted on a PCB but has a right angle connector to interface with a fiber.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the role of the
for the Package. The
simulates the mounting surface for the terminals in the case of surface mounted parts and in the case of through-hole technology, an arbitrarily established mounting surface. Terminals are required to approach the
from the top, which is the side where the values on the Z axis are positive. Package installation is defined to be only from the top of the
in order to reduce orientation errors between two-dimensional and three-dimensional models in this part of ISO 10303.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Package is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Package as its . There shall be no more than one
for a particular Package.
specifies the sum of maximum_body_height_above_seating_plane and maximum_seating_plane_installation_offset.

specifies a derived value of TRUE or FALSE, depending on the existence of the optional attribute maximum_body_height_below_seating_plane. If the attribute exists, the value is TRUE. If the attribute is no present, the value is FALSE.

specifies maximum package vertical extent that is a maximum of sum of maximum_body_height_above_seating_plane and maximum_body_height_below_seating_plane, and sum of maximum_body_height_above_seating_plane and maximum_lead_length_below_seating_plane.
specifies the smallest lead length below the seating plane. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the maximum lead length below the seating plane. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies a that is the minimum length between the body and the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies a that is the minimum length between the body and the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the maximum height of the Package below the seating plane. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: specifies the maximum height of the Package above the seating plane. Since there is no attribute describing the maximum terminal height above the seating plane, this attribute shall be interpreted as the furthest point away from the seating plane of either the body or of any above the seating plane. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.example: In the case of package to be mounted in a cutout, there may only be the surface mounted leads protruding above the seating plane.

ext_description.p: specifies the nominal mounting span of the Package. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the nominal mounting pitch of the Package. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the maximum offset of the seating plane installation of the Package. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies a value of for the Package. The Surface_mount indicates that the Package_terminals have a that is congruent with the package_seating_plane and through_hole indicates the terminals penetrate the package_seating_plane. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Package is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Package as its . There shall be no more than three Package_orientation_features for a particular Package.
the attribute is TRUE only if the size of orientation_feature is one.
the attribute is TRUE only if the size of orientation_feature is two.
the attribute is TRUE only if the size of orientation_feature is three.
If mounting_technology is , then maximum_lead_length_below_seating_plane and least_lead_length_below_seating_plane shall not be provided.
If maximum_lead_length_below_seating_plane is provided, then of maximum_lead_length_below_seating_plane shall be greater than zero.
If least_lead_length_below_seating_plane is provided, then of least_lead_length_below_seating_plane shall be greater than zero.

ext_description.p: If mounting_technology is supplied, then the size of package_seating_plane shall be one.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The refered by of shall be assigned by to at least one with 'package'.
There shall be one in package_accesses.

ext_description.p: Each member of package_accesses except for one shall specify a .
ext_description.note:
Only the
shall not specify a .

ext_description.p: Each member of package_accesses except for one shall specify a .
ext_description.note: Constraints WR6, WR7 and WR8 exist to support user-defined ordering because this part of ISO 10303 does not predefine an order on the terminals. Data that satisfies the constraints will have the properties of a list with unique entries; the list may have missing entries.
ext_description.example: A BGA definition includes a set of relationships that declare that the terminal labeled "AB1" is earlier in the numbering sequence than "BC2". Some of the grid intersections do not have terminals so the grid has voids.
A six pin SIP definition has terminals labeled "1" through "6" inclusively.

ext_description.p: If there is one orientation_feature then it shall be a .

If there are two orientation_features then one of them shall be a
and the other shall be a .
If there are three orientation_features then one of them shall be a , one of them shall be a , and the other one shall be a .

A Package_body is a type of
that is the encasement used in the realization of a . The observer view shall be above the seating plane and shall be higher than the highest point of the Package_body.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
an inherited attribute shall be of type
for the Package_body.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Package_body is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Package_body as its .
There shall be no more than one refering Package_body as .
There shall be no more than one refering Package_body as .
There shall be no more than one refering Package_body as .
The body_material shall be the .

ext_description.p: A Package_body_bottom_surface is a type of that is not visible from an observer located so as to place the component on a substrate. The Package_body_bottom_surface is visible from the seating plane associated with the .
ext_description.note: In typical cases the Package_body_bottom_surface is the surface of the package body closest to the seating plane.

ext_description.p: A Package_body_edge_segment_surface is a type of . A Package_body_edge_segment_surface is a segment along the edge of the body between the top and bottom surfaces.
ext_description.example: A BGA package may have four or five edge segments depending on whether the location of pin A2 is indicated by a chamfered corner.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the
for the Package_body_edge_segment_surface.

specifies the
for the Package_body_edge_segment_surface.
specifies the for the Package_body_edge_segment_surface.

ext_description.p: The start_vertex shall not be the end_vertex.
A Package_body_edge_surface is a type of . A Package_body_edge_surface is the surface between the top and bottom surfaces.
ext_description.note: The structural model of a package provided in this part of ISO 10303 is not intended to be exhaustive but to provide for coverage of typical needs in physical design, including spacing checks. It is anticipated that if complex shapes are desired, then the three dimensional geometric modeling support provided will be used.
ext_description.example: A usual case for a structural model of a TO-99 case in two dimensions would be that the cross-section of maximum extent would be used to derive the edge segments, because that cross-section is where the orientation tab is located.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Package_body_surface is a type of . A Package_body_surface is one of a , a , a , or a . A Package_body_surface relationship to the seating plane may be explicitly established. If an explicit relationship is not established the interpretation shall be that the bottom surface is adjacent to or congruent with the seating plane.
specifies the role of the for the Package_body_surface.

ext_description.p: A Package_body_top_surface is a type of that is visible from any observer located so as to place the component on a substrate.
ext_description.note: In typical cases in a three dimensional model, the normal vector of the geometric item representing the Package_body_top_surface is parallel with the normal vector of the geometric item representing the seating plane.

ext_description.p: A Package_terminal is a type of and a type of . When the case or package body is used as a terminal, then Package_terminal shall be populated to specify the feature of the that serves that purpose. The Package_terminal shall be in a sequence, with the initial member being , and each member that is not a shall reference the previous member in the sequence using the attribute inherited from . The shall be populated. When the connection area inherited from the supertype of this Application Object is populated, the interpretation shall be that the inherited connection area overrides the .
ext_description.note: The feature_shape specified by the terminal or mounting feature may be the same feature_shape that is specified by the associated . In this case the whole terminal is the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Package_terminal is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Package_terminal as its . There shall be one or more Usage_concept_usage_relationships for a particular Package_terminal.

an inherited attribute shall be of type
for the Package_terminal.

an inherited attribute shall be of type
for the Package_terminal.

ext_description.p:
On Package_terminal, the direct application of
shall not be provided.
ext_description.note:
Surface conditions of the Package_terminal are inherited from the
attribute of the
that is in the role of definition for the Package_terminal.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Package_terminal_template_definition is a type of . The seating_plane_zone shall not exist if the seating_plane_intersection attribute is 'does not intersect'. The seating_plane_intersection attribute shall not be 'does not intersect' if the seating_plane_zone attribute exists.
The
referenced indirectly by this terminal may be in the role of
for the
referenced by .
Figure 5 illustrates a cutaway view of a terminal template definition and shows the characteristics related to the definition.
Package_terminal_template_definition characteristics

specifies the role of the
for the Package_terminal_template_definition. There shall exist one or more characteristics for the Package_terminal_template_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
specifies the
on the outside surface of the Package_terminal_template_definition. There may be more than one
for a Package_terminal_template_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If the source system contains the data, then the external_connection_zone shall be supplied.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the
on the inside portion of the Package_terminal_template_definition. There may be more than one
in the role of internal_connection_zone. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
specifies the
for the Package_terminal_template_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies whether or not the shape of the Package_terminal_template_definition intersects the shape of the seating plane to within the tolerance of the geometric context. The values allowed for the attribute are 'surface_intersection', 'through_intersection', 'does_not_intersect'.
ext_description.note: Not all terminals need to intersect the seating plane.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the outer surface of the Package_terminal_template_definition surface material.

specifies the of the Package_terminal_template_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified. There may be more than one
for a Package_terminal_template_definition.
specifies the role of the for the Package_terminal_template_definition core material. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the that represents the diameter of a Package_terminal_template_definition. The is the diameter of a circle that circumscribes the cross-sectional shape of the terminal.

ext_description.p: specifies the role of the for the Package_terminal_template_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
an attribute's value becomes TRUE only then seating_plane_zone exists and it's
is of .

an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Package_terminal_template_definition is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Package_terminal_template_definition as its . There shall exist not more than one
for a Package_terminal_template_definition.

If seating_plane_zone is provided, then it's
shall be in external_connection_zone.

If seating_plane_zone is provided, then seating_plane_intersection shall be
or .
If seating_plane_zone is provided, then seating_plane_intersection shall not be .
If terminal_core_material is provided, it shall be the .
The terminal_surface_material shall be the .

ext_description.p: The lead_form or the external_lead_form shall be provided but not both.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Package_terminal_surface_constituent_relationship is a type of . It associates the surface of the package to a terminal via .

an inherited attribute shall be of type
for the Package_terminal_surface_constituent_relationship.

an inherited attribute shall be of type
for the Package_terminal_surface_constituent_relationship.

ext_description.p: A Primary_reference_terminal is a type of . This terminal is assigned the identifier string that is first in the sequence of package terminal names to be assigned to the part. The Primary_reference_terminal shall not specify a and is the first member of the sequence of . The sort order of the names assigned to the Packaged_terminals is defined by the explicit sequence established by the use of inherited from .
ext_description.example: If a value of '1' is available, assigning a value of '2' to this terminal would be prohibited by this part of ISO 10303, due to the possibility of confusion.
ext_description.note: The Primary_reference_terminal is often associated with an orientation feature, but it may not be the orientation feature itself. Usually the Primary_reference_terminal and the are different part_features.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The
shall not be populated.

ext_description.p:
A Visual_orientation_feature is a type of . A Visual_orientation_feature provides visible or tactile means to reduce or eliminate ambiguity of the location of a
in an assembly operation.
ext_description.note: Other orientation information may be required in addition to the Visual_orientation_feature to totally disambiguate the correct orientation.
ext_description.example: A mark on a component implemented with ink or a visible indentation or a formed corner may be used to indicate the fact that pin one of the package is in close proximity to the mark. A vision system or a human operator will use the mark to correctly orient the component.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the
for the Visual_orientation_feature.

specifies the
for the Visual_orientation_feature. There shall be one or two package_body_surfaces for a Visual_orientation_feature. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: A Polarity_indication_feature is a type of . A Polarity_indication_feature provides visible or tactile means to reduce or eliminate ambiguity of the location of a polarized part in an assembly operation. A Polarity_indication_feature shall not be used to identify orientation features of non-polarized components.
ext_description.note: Other orientation information may be required in addition to the Polarity_indication_feature to totally disambiguate the correct orientation.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the for the polarity indication feature.
specifies a set of for the polarity indication feature. There may be one or two for the Polarity_indication_feature. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

an inherited attribute shall be of type
for the Polarity_indication_feature.

ext_description.p: A Primary_orientation_feature is a type of . A Primary_orientation_feature is the first orientation feature in the sequence of one to three orientation features associated with the .
ext_description.note: A Primary_orientation_feature is not usually also a .

example.p: Figure 6 illustrates two of the three-dimensional geometric relationships between a component and the printed circuit board it is mounted on. A datum system is included for reference purposes. The Z direction is parallel to the normal of the top surface of the board. Both the top and bottom surface normal vectors are parallel to the normal vectors of the seating plane for the components.
Figure 7 illustrates two of the two-dimensional geometric relationships between a component and the printed circuit board it is mounted on. A datum system is included for reference purposes.
Figures 8 through 9 illustrates orientation details for microcircuit packages. In Figures 8 and 9 the bottom surface of the package is the . The assignment of Datum A indicates this fact.

Figure 10 illustrates details associated with several variations of an Axial package modification and the associated . In each case , the seating plane orientation with respect to the is constant, while the shape orientation changes due to the modification.

Figure 11 illustrates assignment and also assignment of . Knowledge of Polarity_indication_features separate from the orientation feature increases the ability to determine when to use polarity indication symbols on the interconnect substrate for polarized components e.g., polarized capacitors, diodes).

figure.title: Eight lead gull wing orientation features

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Secondary_orientation_feature is a type of . A Secondary_orientation_feature provides anti-rotation capability for unambiguous orientation of the part in the datum reference frame. A Secondary_orientation_feature is the second orientation feature in the sequence of one to three orientation features associated with the .
If a Secondary_orientation_feature is populated for a , then a member of
shall be populated for that .

A Tertiary_orientation_feature is a type of . A Tertiary_orientation_feature provides anti-rotation capability for unambiguous orientation of the part in the datum reference frame. A Tertiary_orientation_feature is the third orientation feature in the sequence of one to three orientation features associated with the . If a Tertiary_orientation_feature is populated for a , then a member of
and a member of
shall be populated for that .

A Wire_terminal is a type of where the explicit shape of the terminal is not predefined in a library. A Wire_terminal shall reference a member of for the
inherited from .

A Wire_terminal_template_definition is a type of a
which
is inherently flexible and ready for installation to a
without prior formal preparation by shape modification. The shape of the Wire_terminal_template_definition is incompletely defined in the library.

specifies the
for the length of the Wire_terminal_template_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

an inherited attribute shall be of type
for the Wire_terminal_template_definition. There shall be one or more for the Wire_terminal_template_definition. The internal_connection_zone is mandatory because it locates the end of the wire that is the attachment area on the package body.

A Package_orientation_feature is a type of . This permits the explicit creation of reference frames in order to support unambiguous orientation independent of differences between model coordinate systems because the datum reference frames are based on model geometry and not arbitrary coordinate systems. This supports easier exchange and conversion of model libraries because the mapping is not dependent on discovery of coordinate system orientation differences. A Package_orientation_feature participates in providing for the unambiguous orientation of a part in its next assembly. A Package_orientation_feature is either a
or a
or a .
specifies the role of the for the Package_orientation_feature. There shall exist one or two Package_body_surfaces for a Package_orientation_feature. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

an inherited attribute shall be of type
for the Package_orientation_feature.

ext_description.p: A Package_orientation_feature shall define a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The add_data_element functions returns the that is the sum of Length_data_elements specified by input1 and input2.
the first specified .
the second specified .
The max_data_element functions returns the that is the maximum of Length_data_elements specified by input1 and input2.
the first specified .
the second specified .
